messages.message:
How many free spots do we have in the van/hotel room?  David, Tim sappio and I (3 people) need a ride.  Is there room? Do we have room in the hotel for Tim?

--Mike

Brian
I was thinking about blowing him off because he is a piece of shit.  Jessie and Jessica are coming too.  I don't know if I will have room for him in my car.  I can take 5 including myself.

Brian
David is also going to be driving but not until late Thursday, I was thinking of letting megan deal with tim since she is also getting money from the school to pay for part of this trip.  We should have plenty of car space coming back because jessie may also be driving back with us.
yeah i agree,  fuck that guy.

http://www.boingboing.net/2010/07/26/the-neuroscience-of.html?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+boingboing%2FiBag+(Boing+Boing)&utm_content=Google+Reader

This attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

Brian
Jessie is going to love this, god dammit.
So is Jessie going to have a badge?

Brian
I am thinking not.  She will probably just hang out in the room, walk around, and do other stuff with friends in Vegas during the day.  Then at night she will probably want to party with us, and crash at the room with me.

So, let me make sure I'm right.  Your going to pick David and I up at work around Noon on Thursday?

Thanks,
Mike

Brian
If noon is alright with you, I have to get back, load the new vehicle, and get out of flagstaff in order to make it in time for the bbq.
I really want to go to the bbq so if it needs to be earlier, then so be it.

Brian
Mike,
Would you be interested in doing a full day hike somewhere in Sedona, just in case the weather goes south, be will have the option to bail in the middle of the day?  I am thinking of finding a trail by 8 AM, possibly the same trail, and not returning until after 7 at night.  We could spend Sunday on other things, I would like to get some coding done for example and just hanging out.
I would be a lot more comfortable with a day hike, since I am not nearly as confident in my survival abilities as you and Jessie are.  Obviously if we get down to that trail and spend only 6 hours to the halfway point, we could probably finish in a day, but I have heard this is difficult to do.

Here are some recent attacks in the news:
http://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2010/08/cloning_retail.html
http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2010-08/02/high-security-locks-cracked
Awesome redux of an xss attack:
https://blogs.apache.org/infra/entry/apache_org_04_09_2010

Also you should watch Tiger Team,  there are only two episodes 101 and 102

Bypassing electronic locks:
http://www.youtube.com/view_play_list?p=3EB130354469B7B0
getting into safes:
http://www.youtube.com/view_play_list?p=6BE9A3E3579EF805
mechanical locks:
http://www.youtube.com/view_play_list?p=5757EB08442557E8
vending machines:
http://www.youtube.com/view_play_list?p=77073EC63820DAB4

The best lock for your house is the Schlage Primus:
http://everestprimus.schlage.com/

But the biggest deal for NAU would be to clone an NAU id,  i hear they are using RFID chips these days...  Massive mistake.

This attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

Brian
Dude, awesome, I'll work them in and then we can practice what to say.

Hey man what are you upto this weekend?  I'd like to take care of some stuff up at NAU if possible.  Maybe we can kick it?

Peace

Brian
Hey, looks like my message didn't go through earlier.  My parents will be in town after we get back from our trip late Friday.  They are staying until Saturday and we will probably spend most of the day fixing up the condo and doing chores.  But I would love to hang out in the evenings and we should definitely work on our talk.  Its going to be so awesome, I am very confident.

Jessie and David both have cars available now, so try to get in touch with jessie, I am sure she will be more than willing to come pick you up.  I can obviously take you home Monday.  This might also be a good time to get a uhaul, but I'm not sure when you are done working.  Let me know what the plans is and hopefully I will see you Friday night when I get back!

Cool thanks man,  sounds like a plan.  I have some ideas about the talk.   My last day of work is the 27th and I plan on moving that weekend.  That is going to be hectic.  I'm looking forward to school starting.  I'll be taking the network security class. 

peace

Brian
Oh really?  I might be taking that class too, its with kefei though, so we could probably teach it.

Brian
To start off our talk, instead of introducing ourselves, I am going to type "brian c" in to the publicly available ldap search for nau, then ask an audience member for their first name and last initial. And then talk about social engineering and how that can provide a base for hacking someone's life and how stupid it is to make all that information available.  This would be a good time to get in to identity theft and rfid.

That could work.  I really want to clone the RFID studen't ids,  i was looking into the cost of a 125khz reader/writer and i think i can get one for ~$100,  maybe we can split the cost.  (A usb reader is like $20).  This would be the killer attack,  NAU administration would take note,  so would his massive FB group (http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=108986212467151).
Attachment Unavailable
This attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

Brian
Let's do it, I'll split it.  I need your help with that one for sure so if you have done the research I'm down for the cost.  That one will be big for sure.
We will use that and run the name through our script that rips ldap, facebook, myspace, and google for as much information as possible.  I'll write the script to pull the facebook and ldap information.

Brian
If it fills up to the point where they won't let anyone else in, we should have david open the fire exit for us to get on stage, lol.  That will make a good quick reference to the vulnerabilities of staff and buildings.

This is a killer price on a 125khz reader/writer:
http://www.priority1design.com.au/shopfront/index.php?main_page=product_info&cPath=1&products_id=16
We'll have to buy a couple of writable fobs after that,  and they are pretty cheap like ~$1 a pop.  It comes with software for reading/writing.

I'm still not 100% sure they are using the 125khz tags.  If you could find out more information that would be huge.   Like what manufacture,  product and possible a version number.  How are they being used?  Building entrance?  Finances?    We can do some more research from there.

Brian
Will do, let's hold off on the purchase until next week.

Brian
This article can be found in a bunch of places, might be worth touching on http://www.facebook.com/topic.php?uid=77629157960&topic=10686
I've been thinking a lot about organization.

Brian
Find some cheap credit card and passport shields, let's order 100 if the price is right to sell at our talk.  We can mark it up a bunch.

Brian
Jessie made a wrong turn and went towards cottonwood.  She will be a little behind, probably will be there around 5:30.  Sryz
Shit,  what is her #?

Okay,  so i'm getting kicked out of the office pretty soon.  I have no way of getting home.  So if something where to happen i'd be spending the night on the porch. To top things off I don't have my cellphone, Fuck!   I'm sure she'll be here soon...

Brian
SELECT *, ((LOCATE("massive", id) > 0)+(LOCATE("attack", id) > 0)+(LOCATE("groove", id) > 0))*10-ABS(LENGTH(id) - 21)+((LOCATE("massive", Filename) > 0)+(LOCATE("attack", Filename) > 0)+(LOCATE("groove", Filename) > 0))*10-ABS(LENGTH(Filename) - 21)+((LOCATE("massive", Filemime) > 0)+(LOCATE("attack", Filemime) > 0)+(LOCATE("groove", Filemime) > 0))*10-ABS(LENGTH(Filemime) - 21)+((LOCATE("massive", Filesize) > 0)+(LOCATE("attack", Filesize) > 0)+(LOCATE("groove", Filesize) > 0))*10-ABS(LENGTH(Filesize) - 21)+((LOCATE("massive", Filedate) > 0)+(LOCATE("attack", Filedate) > 0)+(LOCATE("groove", Filedate) > 0))*10-ABS(LENGTH(Filedate) - 21)+((LOCATE("massive", Filetype) > 0)+(LOCATE("attack", Filetype) > 0)+(LOCATE("groove", Filetype) > 0))*10-ABS(LENGTH(Filetype) - 21)+((LOCATE("massive", Filepath) > 0)+(LOCATE("attack", Filepath) > 0)+(LOCATE("groove", Filepath) > 0))*10-ABS(LENGTH(Filepath) - 21) AS Relevance FROM files WHERE ((LOCATE("massive", id) > 0 OR LOCATE("attack", id) > 0 OR LOCATE("groove", id) > 0) OR (LOCATE("massive", Filename) > 0 OR LOCATE("attack", Filename) > 0 OR LOCATE("groove", Filename) > 0) OR (LOCATE("massive", Filemime) > 0 OR LOCATE("attack", Filemime) > 0 OR LOCATE("groove", Filemime) > 0) OR (LOCATE("massive", Filesize) > 0 OR LOCATE("attack", Filesize) > 0 OR LOCATE("groove", Filesize) > 0) OR (LOCATE("massive", Filedate) > 0 OR LOCATE("attack", Filedate) > 0 OR LOCATE("groove", Filedate) > 0) OR (LOCATE("massive", Filetype) > 0 OR LOCATE("attack", Filetype) > 0 OR LOCATE("groove", Filetype) > 0) OR (LOCATE("massive", Filepath) > 0 OR LOCATE("attack", Filepath) > 0 OR LOCATE("groove", Filepath) >  0)) AND (LEFT(Filepath, 1) = "/" AND Filepath != "/") AND (LEFT(Filepath, 19) != "/var/www/dev/users/" OR Filepath = "/var/www/dev/users/" OR (LEFT(Filepath, 19) = "/var/www/dev/users/" AND LOCATE("/", Filepath, 20) = LENGTH(Filepath)) OR LEFT(Filepath, 25) = "/var/www/dev/users/admin/" OR SUBSTR(Filepath, 19 + LOCATE("/", SUBSTR(Filepath, 20)),  = "/public/") ORDER BY Relevance DESC,Filepath DESC LIMIT 0,50

some more card hacks:
http://www.thelocal.de/sci-tech/20100824-29359.html
http://hackaday.com/2010/09/07/face-slapping-security-gaff-in-stored-value-cards/

Basically its really difficult to ID cards.  Smartcards are the most secure,  but even they can broken.

Brian
cool

I felt as though you where distant last night, I wanted to hang out and drop some youtubes like we normally do.   I know I have hurt you and I'm sorry.  I don't want to hurt you but its this whole fucked up situation.  I don't have an easy solution and I don't think anyone does.

I really enjoyed the times we had over the summer.   But they weren't all good for me.   There where times when you where with Jessi and I felt isolated.  I remember one time trying to go to sleep on the couch and crying because I felt so alone.   I'm not dictating how you should feel or how you should express your emotions.   Its okay to feel bad sometimes.  But it hurts me to think of how this is affecting our friendship.   I want to hang out with you,  but you seem distant.   We should work on some hacks,  maybe this Sunday or another time when we can meet up with Bryce,  Kenny and Leah (Or maybe not Leah...).

I told Bryce and Kenny to look at  The Whitebox and to read A Study In Scarlet (short paper).    You should do the same,  and we'll meet up and go over the material.   My real motivation is I want these people to get CVE numbers,  you included. 

http://code.google.com/p/thewhitebox/  http://www.securereality.com.au/studyinscarlet.txt

Then lets order some hardware and buy something with a clone of an RFID tag.  To be honest I'm not too interested in the other aspects of this talk.  Its just kind of bs "how to hack",  its not technical enough for real hackers and its over the heads of stupid users or boring to them. Real hacking is extremely boring and takes a lot of research and dedication, if you aren't willing to put that in than you don't deserve the skill.  Leah wants to work on bullshit wargames that have absolutely nothing to do with real hacking.  She doesn't have the dedication to understand or hunt for the most simple of vulnerabilities.  She is a good example of the majority of people who say that they are interested in hacking. 

One thing that could be interesting is the twitter xss worms,  and maybe talk about the Sammy myspace xss worm.  Also how url shortening can be used to deliver a an attack,  http://mcaf.ee/ is aimed at trying to stop that.

Brian
If you encrypt the cypher text (result in 3.1.txt) with the message text you will get the key, if you encrypt the 3.1.txt with the key you will get the message text.  They reverse each other, so brute force would still work with a dictionary.

If you can make a calendar gadget you should:http://code.google.com/apis/calendar/gadgets/

Another option is to use the PHP data api:
http://code.google.com/apis/calendar/data/1.0/developers_guide_php.html

If you do need a database/web app  then i would think about doing it in python or java (gross)  because then you can host it on appengine for free.

http://security.stackexchange.com/questions/13105/is-it-possible-to-turn-a-computer-into-a-bomb
hardware - Is it possible to turn a computer into a bomb? - IT Security - Stack Exchange
I know this newspaper article sounds absurd. Even if a machine is compromised we (should) have hardware safe guards in all our devices to prevent the software from damaging the hardware. But is it possible to make a computer explode or catch fire? Has this ever been done?
security.stackexchange.com
